sections.content: Apper is your AI app creator! It's not just powered by AI ‚Äî it is AI. Kind of like ChatGPT, but instead of giving you answers, Apper builds fully functional apps based on your inputs in a few minutes!

sections.heading: How Apper Works
sections.content: You don't need to write code, pick design templates, or juggle multiple tools to handle different parts of an app. With Apper, everything happens in one place, all through a simple conversation (chat interface).

sections.content: In a crowded market of app-building tools, Apper takes a fundamentally different approach. While others require you to learn their platform, Apper learns from you! It's the difference between speaking a new language and having a conversation in your own words.

sections.content: Unlike traditional no-code platforms that still require you to understand templates, drag-and-drop interfaces, and technical concepts, Apper works purely through natural conversation. You simply describe what you want, and it builds it for you!

items: Pure AI conversation - no templates or drag-and-drop required

One unified platform - no need to switch between multiple tools

sections.heading: The Apper Advantage
sections.content: Traditional platforms make you adapt to their way of thinking. Apper adapts to yours! Whether you're a business owner with an idea, a designer with a vision, or a developer who wants to prototype quickly, Apper meets you where you are and builds what you need.

title: Create Your First App üéâ
subtitle: Step-by-step guide to building your first application

sections.heading: üöÄ Getting Started
sections.content: When you log in to Apper, you'll see a large prompt box in the center of the screen. This is where you tell Apper what kind of app you want to build, just like you're explaining it to a friend.

sections.heading: üí° Pro Tip for Better Results
sections.content: This will give you a much better starting point! Using a detailed prompt, Apper will be able to generate your app more accurately based on your needs.

sections.heading: üìù Step-by-Step: How to Write a Better Prompt with ChatGPT

steps.title: Open ChatGPT in a new tab
steps.description: Navigate to ChatGPT in your browser to start refining your prompt.

steps.title: Copy and paste the following prompt into ChatGPT
steps.description: "I want to build [Insert your app idea here]. Rewrite this as a detailed prompt focused on the app's main function and detailed features. It should be simple, clear, easy to understand, and ready to use in an AI app creator."

steps.title: Replace the placeholder with your actual idea
steps.description: Replace the part that says [Insert your app idea here] with your actual idea. For example: I want to build an app that helps users book yoga classes and pay online.

steps.title: Get the improved version from ChatGPT
steps.description: ChatGPT will rewrite your idea into a cleaner, more detailed prompt.

steps.title: üöÄ Copy and paste into Apper
steps.description: Copy the improved version ChatGPT gives you, and paste it into the Apper prompt box. You're ready to build!

title: Your App Is Being Built... üî®
subtitle: Watch as Apper creates your app in real-time with intelligent progress updates

sections.content: In the center of the screen, you'll see a friendly message letting you know that your app is being set up. You don't have to do anything just yet ‚Äî Apper is preparing everything for you automatically.

sections.heading: Real-Time Progress Updates
sections.content: Meanwhile, you'll see a message in the left-hand chat interface that walks you through what's happening, something like:

items: üîç Analyzing your request and breaking it into clear features
‚öôÔ∏è Setting up the right components, pages, and workflows
üé® Building an intuitive, responsive interface
üöÄ Preparing a first version focused on your core idea

sections.content: This chat updates as progress is made! You can even interact with it and ask for tweaks, request additions, or just sit back and watch things come together.

title: Your App's First Version Is Ready üéâ
subtitle: Explore your newly created app and see what Apper has built for you

sections.content: Once the setup is complete, your app's first version appears right on the dashboard!

sections.heading: What You Can Expect
items: ‚úÖ Some parts of your app are already working and clickable; you can explore and check them out
Others are just visual for now ‚Äî they'll come to life as you add more logic
You can explore the app layout, click around, and get a feel for what's been generated so far

sections.content: This is your starting point - a solid foundation that you can build upon and customize to match your exact vision!

title: How to Edit, Modify, or Add New Features to Your App üîß
subtitle: Use the AI chat assistant to continuously improve and expand your app

sections.content: On the left-hand side, you'll see the Apper AI chat assistant! This is where you can keep building your app, just by having a conversation.

sections.heading: ‚ú® Making Changes is Simple
sections.content: You can type exactly what you want next! For example:

items: "Add a page to manage bookings."
"Make the save button actually store data."
"Each button should be large, with both an icon and text for clarity."

sections.content: Or, if you're not sure what to do next, just click one of the suggestions the assistant has already listed in the chat!

sections.heading: ‚ö° Instant Updates
sections.content: Apper will immediately start updating your app based on your input! Explore, customize, and keep building ‚Äî all right from the same screen.

title: What to do when you encounter build issues üõ†Ô∏è
subtitle: Quick solutions for common setup problems

sections.heading: What If You Encounter an Error
sections.content: If something goes wrong during setup, you might see a message saying "Build was unsuccessful."

sections.heading: No Need to Worry
sections.content: Don't worry ‚Äî you don't need to debug anything yourself. Just click "Fix It Now" and Apper will automatically take care of the issue for you. Once it's fixed, your app will reload, and you can continue building right where you left off.

title: Switch Between Desktop and Mobile Views
subtitle: Preview your app across different devices

sections.content: Want to see how your app looks on different devices? Use the view toggle buttons at the top right of the screen (just beside the refresh icon).

items: üñ•Ô∏è Click the desktop icon to view how your app appears on larger screens
üì± Click the mobile icon to instantly switch to a phone-sized preview
This helps you make sure your app looks great and works smoothly across all screen sizes (no surprises later)
You can switch views anytime while editing or previewing your app

sections.content: Alternatively, you can also click the View App (or Live Preview) button (positioned right next to the view toggle buttons) to open a full-sized version of your app in a new tab. This will show exactly how your users will see your app.

title: Version Management üìä
subtitle: Track and manage your app versions

sections.heading: Loading and Navigation
sections.content: Click on any version to load it ‚Äî the app will automatically re-initialize with that version's state. You can also scroll through your chat history on the left to find previous versions.

sections.heading: What Each Version Includes
items: A summary of what changed
A Preview button to view it
A Restore button to bring it back instantly

sections.heading: Benefits of Version Management
sections.content: This makes it easy to test ideas, fix mistakes, or roll back to a version that worked ‚Äî anytime you need.
Now that your app is almost ready, it's time to take care of a few essentials, like what your app is called, who can access it, how people sign up, how to charge users, and more.
You'll find all of these in the 'Manage App' section. Let's get started.

sections.heading: Rename Your App in Apper
sections.content: As your app starts to take shape, it's a good idea to give it a proper name ‚Äî one that accurately reflects what it does.
Apper makes this easy. You can update your app's name anytime from the 'Manage App' settings in the top menu bar, no complicated setup needed.

title: Let Users Log In and Sign Up üîê
subtitle: Set up user authentication and account management

sections.content: If you want users to create accounts, log in, or access premium features of your app, you'll need to set up Login and Signup.
Apper makes this really easy. You can let users:

items: Sign up with your email and password
Log in with Google
Use Facebook to sign in

sections.heading: Choose Whether Users Can Log In via Email or Phone Number
sections.content: You can decide how users log in ‚Äî using an email address, a phone number, or both.
This lets you choose what's easiest for your audience, whether it's international users, mobile-first users, or businesses.

sections.heading: Set Up Email Verification
sections.content: If you're using email-based login, you can turn on email verification to confirm that users are signing up with real email addresses.
This adds an extra layer of trust and helps you avoid fake or mistyped accounts.
When enabled, users will receive a verification link in their email after signing up. They'll need to click the verification link to access your app.

sections.heading: Set Password Rules for Better Security and User Experience
sections.content: When you allow email or phone login, you can define what kind of passwords users need to create.
For example, you can:

items: Set a minimum number of characters
Require symbols or numbers
Let users reset passwords easily, & more

sections.content: This helps you keep accounts safe while making the login setup smooth for users.

sections.heading: Let Users Sign In with Google or Facebook
sections.content: To let users sign in with their Google or Facebook account, you need to connect your app to those platforms.
Apper gives you 2 ways to make this work:

sections.heading: Option 1: Use the Default Setup (Simple and automatic)
sections.content: When you turn the 'Use Default Credentials' toggle on, Apper uses a secure connection it has already set up with Google and Facebook.
Users can still log in with just a click, but the login screen will show Apper's name instead of yours. That's because you're using Apper's shared connection, not your own.
This is ideal for testing, prototyping, or if you don't need custom branding yet.

sections.heading: Option 2: Use Your Own Setup (For custom branding and control)
sections.content: You might want the login pop-up to show your app's name and logo, especially if you're preparing to launch your app publicly.
In that case, you can connect your own setup with Google & Facebook (instead of using Apper's default shared connection).
It's a one-time setup and takes just a few minutes.
Once it's done, just copy and paste the Client ID, Client Secret, and Callback URL from your setup into Apper. Here's how:

sections.heading: Not sure which option to choose?
sections.content: Start with the default as it works instantly. You can always switch to your own setup anytime.

title: Set Up Onboarding & Other Imp Emails for Your App üìß
subtitle: Built-in email system for user communication

sections.content: As users sign up and start using your app, you'll want to send them helpful emails to guide their journey (for confirming their email, or resetting a password, etc.)
Apper offers built-in support for creating and sending such system emails, so you don't need to connect any email service to get started.

sections.heading: Available Email Templates
items: Email Confirmation ‚Äì to verify a new user's email
Reset Password ‚Äì when someone forgets their login
Invite User ‚Äì to bring others into a team or workspace
Subscription Receipt ‚Äì after a successful payment
Sign In with OTP ‚Äì to send secure one-time login links

sections.content: You can customize these templates to match your app's tone and branding ‚Äî or create your own emails and sequences.

subtitle: Control user access and organize your team

sections.content: You can invite users, create profiles, and assign specific permissions to control access to tables and pages. This ensures that each user sees only what they need, keeping your data secure and organized.

sections.heading: User Management Features
items: Create User Profiles ‚Äì Set up detailed user accounts with roles and information
Assign Permissions ‚Äì Control what each user can view, edit, or delete
Manage Team Access ‚Äì Organize users into teams with specific access rights

sections.heading: üí° Best Practices
items: Start with basic roles and expand as needed
Regularly review and update user permissions
Use the principle of least privilege
Train team leads on user management best practices

title: Billing and Revenue üí∞
subtitle: Set up pricing, subscriptions, and payment collection

sections.content: You've built something great with Apper ‚Äî now it's time to start earning from it. Whether it's a tool, course, or community, Apper makes it easy to set up pricing, offer subscriptions, and collect payments.
To keep things flexible, the Billing & Revenue section is divided into three parts:

items: Tiers & Plans: Your main pricing structure
Addons / Credits ‚Äì Extra features or pay-as-you-go upgrades
Stripe Settings ‚Äì for accepting real payments

sections.content: Let's take a quick look at what each one does.

sections.heading: Tier and Plans
sections.content: This is where you set up the core pricing options for your app. You can offer free plans, paid subscriptions, or both ‚Äî and control what users get with each one.

sections.heading: Use this section to:
items: Set pricing (monthly, yearly, or custom)
Decide what each plan includes
Add limits (like number of users or credits)

sections.heading: Addons / Credits
sections.content: Addons let users purchase extra features or resources without changing their main plan. This is great for things like:

items: Additional AI credits
Extra storage
Bonus tools
One-time unlocks

sections.content: Perfect for apps that offer flexibility or usage-based pricing.

sections.heading: Stripe Settings
sections.content: Connect your Stripe account to start accepting real payments ‚Äî securely and automatically.

sections.heading: Stripe handles:
items: One-time and recurring transactions
Subscription billing
Invoices and payouts

title: Code üíª
subtitle: Access and customize your app's code directly

sections.content: Apper builds everything for you ‚Äî from logic to layout ‚Äî without needing you to write any code.
But for advanced customizations, the Code section gives you direct access to the code that powers your app.

sections.heading: You can use this to:
items: Make fine-tuned changes beyond the visual builder
Add logic or custom functions manually
Review or debug the generated code

sections.content: This is especially useful for developers or technical users who want more control, or for those working with a developer on their team.
Even though you don't need to use this section to launch your app, it's here if you want to take more control and customize things your way.

title: Connect Database üóÑÔ∏è
subtitle: Automatic data management and structure setup

sections.content: Every app needs a place to store data ‚Äî like user info, form submissions, orders, or messages. That's what the Database does.
Apper creates and manages your database automatically based on how your app works, so you don't have to set anything up manually.
Before Apper sets up your database, it asks you to choose your app type ‚Äî so it knows how to organize your data properly.

sections.heading: You'll choose one of two options:
items: Employee App ‚Äì Each user sees only their own data
Customer-Facing App ‚Äì Each customer can have multiple users with shared access

sections.content: This choice helps Apper set up the right structure and permissions behind the scenes ‚Äî so your app behaves the way it should.
